intro: Pavonia preslii, commonly known as the Preslia's wood rose, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, pink to reddish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Pavonia preslii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
